title: The Flour Wars
description: Rival millers Hask and Doreth have been sabotaging each other's deliveries. A third bakery received flour mixed with plaster dust. You are asked to mediate.

turns.narrative: Baker Yena shows you the ruined plaster-flour. She nearly lost two teeth. Both Hask and Doreth deny responsibility with equal ferocity.
turns.consequence_a: At Hask's mill you find a recently emptied plaster bucket. At Doreth's you find mud matching Hask's storage path.
turns.choice_b: Arrange a sit-down and read the room
turns.consequence_b: Doreth's body language reveals guilt — pressed, he admits paying a courier to switch Hask's labels.

turns.narrative: Doreth is identified as the saboteur but claims Hask started it by bribing his workers.
turns.choice_a: Verify Hask's bribery claim before ruling
turns.consequence_a: One of Doreth's workers confirms the bribery, making both men share responsibility.
turns.choice_b: Rule against Doreth alone and demand restitution to Yena
turns.consequence_b: Doreth seethes but pays Yena for ruined flour and her damaged tooth.

turns.narrative: You propose a permanent resolution to end the Flour Wars.
turns.choice_a: Have both millers sign a non-sabotage contract before the Ward Warden
turns.choice_b: Negotiate supply territories — Hask takes north, Doreth south
turns.consequence_b: Yena finally gets reliable flour from both.

contract_signed.description: Both millers signed a formal agreement.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

conclusion: Both millers signed a formal agreement.
